February 2023 "Giving people their flowers" is a beautiful expression that means acknowledging and appreciating individuals while they are alive to receive the recognition. It's about expressing gratitude and admiration to someone for their positive impact, talents, or contributions. By "giving flowers," you are metaphorically presenting appreciation, kindness, and acknowledgment to people who deserve it. It's a reminder to celebrate and recognize others' value and worth in the present moment rather than waiting until a later time. So, let's take a moment to give flowers to those around us ‚Äì to express gratitude, celebrate achievements, and uplift each other. üå∏üíê #GiveFlowers #AppreciationMoment

Everyday heroes walk among us, quietly making a difference in the lives of others through acts of kindness, compassion, and selflessness. Today, I'm grateful for the unsung heroes who inspire us with their generosity and humility. Who is your everyday hero, the one who goes above and beyond to help those in need? Send them a card adorned with symbols of heroism and gratitude, expressing your heartfelt appreciation for their kindness and the positive impact they've had on your life and community. How have everyday heroes touched your life or made a difference in your community? Share your stories of heroism in the comments!

Afternoon Dose of Gratitude: a skilled sister "The grateful mind is constantly fixed upon the best: therefore it tends to become the best; it takes for the form or character of the best, and will receive the best." ~ The Science of Getting Rich by Wallace D. Wattles Every day, there's so much in our careers, business, and entrepreneurial endeavors to be grateful for, you just have to pay attention and be intentional about it. Every day I take a few moments to go live on Facebook to share big or small moments from my day and life that I'm grateful for. LinkedIn Article: ‚ÄúA Message of Gratitude‚Äù. Link in the comments.

‚ÄúYour personal experiences with anything will make up maybe 0.00000001% of what‚Äôs happened in the world, but maybe 80% of how you think the world works.‚Äù This is true of everything in your life. While we tend to believe what is happening to us is of the upmost importance, zoom out, and really try to wrap your head around that you are 1 out of 8 billion people. Just think, did you have a nice glass of water today? Great, but 1/4 people in the world don‚Äôt have access to clean water. So you should be grateful. When we go through our day, it‚Äôs easy to get caught in the negative. Try your best to continue to stay above it and show gratitude for where you are, who you have, and what you have. If you truly need assistance, look towards your local resources for help. It‚Äôs easy to think we are alone when we act collectively as self interested. It‚Äôs better to think we are a part of a something when we all try to focus on how we can continue to help others. Please, be easy on yourself, take a deep breath, and try to gain some perspective
